So I was just doing this video and I loved it <3 But you know when things dont go as you wish at first and then you get rewarded? At first I was bummed as I suddenly had a problem with my laptop's earphone jack, when I remove the earphones the sound refuses to come out of the laptop, I never did a yoga workout with my earphones on. At first I felt a bit annoyed but I immediately calmed down with how soothing Adrienne's voice is but what I LOVED most is that by the end of the video I started hearing a repetitive sound which when I focused with, turned out to be HER HEARTBEATS!!! How awesome is that!! and am literally using the word to mean that I felt awed, be it for a moment, but I felt so happy and intensely connected!! there's a very special thing about the sound of a heartbeat that I cannot express but only feel! hope to know if anyone else noticed it but wow such a cute experience really! thank you Adrienne for everything you do! <3 OOh and am practicing from Tunisia^^

I was expecting puppy posture and I donâ€™t like forearm plank. But once I was in Sphinx pose, it was great. I was stronger in plank than I remembered, and that made the side planks kind of awesome. Itâ€™s about finding strength and growth in the changes and challenges in life.

Dear Adriene,
I write to you a bit under the weather. I noticed via Instagram, that you are too. Feel better friend. I hadn't gotten on the mat for a couple of days, and it showed in my attitude. But tonight I saw this practice on the March calendar. I skipped Shakti Flow (don't have that kind of energy ;)) and went here. When you busted out that surprise forearm plank. I got in it. Then you did the second forearm plank. And I layed there. A second went by and I thought "Did I get on the mat or not? Have I not incorporated yoga into most everyday this year?" So I got up and did the second plank with alternating stretches! Basically... thank you, for helping me instil persistence into my daily life. Wish you well friend, sorry for the long letter. Namaste

â€‹@omgitsthatrandomgal You are welcome! I have been practicing on a yoga towel spread over carpet and also need to moisten the surface slightly when doing any downward dog poses.

A deeper clean could be just what you need to get a grippier surface! Happy breathing, Namaste.

K.C. Wilson thank you :) dampening my hands seems to be working and I will put some water and essential oil in an old perfume bottle as soon as I get the chance :) it's also occurring to me that it may need a deeper clean as it still smells like a factory. K.C. Wilson no I haven't, but I will now! Thank you so much :)
Cork mats should be cleaned regularly (once a week) to prevent body oil buildup. The cork will be grippier when wet - have you tried spritzing with a spray bottle before starting practice?
